metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4605 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The mcopy function in softmagic.c in file 5.x, as used in the Fileinfo component in PHP before 5.4.40, 5.5.x before 5.5.24, and 5.6.x before 5.6.8, does not properly restrict a certain offset value, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted string that is mishandled by a "Python script text executable" rule.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4605` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9

php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9

php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9

No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> unable to reproduce file crash on precise, trusty, or vivid mdeslaur> same fix as CVE-2015-4604

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.9').
